thrash.name: Metallica
thrash.description: One of the most influential thrash metal bands, known for their complex song structures and aggressive sound.
thrash.styleNotes: Evolved from pure thrash to more progressive and alternative styles in the 1990s and 2000s.

thrash.name: Anthrax
thrash.description: One of the "Big Four" thrash bands, known for incorporating rap and punk elements.
thrash.styleNotes: Experimented with different styles including rap-metal crossover.

thrash.name: Kreator
thrash.description: German thrash metal pioneers known for extreme aggression.
thrash.styleNotes: Influenced death metal development with their extreme sound.

thrash.name: Sodom
thrash.description: German thrash metal band known for raw, aggressive sound.

thrash.name: Destruction
thrash.description: German thrash metal band part of the "Teutonic Thrash" scene.
thrash.styleNotes: Known for aggressive vocals and fast riffing.

thrash.name: Dark Angel
thrash.description: American thrash metal band known for extreme speed and complexity.

thrash.name: Vio-lence
thrash.description: Bay Area thrash band known for technical riffs.
thrash.styleNotes: Part of the second wave of Bay Area thrash.

thrash.name: Death Angel
thrash.description: Bay Area thrash band with diverse influences.

thrash.name: Flotsam and Jetsam
thrash.description: American thrash band with progressive tendencies.

thrash.description: German metal band blending thrash and power metal.

death.name: Revocation
death.styleNotes: Blends technical death metal with thrash.

death.name: Death
death.description: Pioneering death metal band founded by Chuck Schuldiner, evolved to incorporate progressive elements.
death.styleNotes: Started as raw death metal, evolved to highly technical and progressive death metal.

death.name: Cannibal Corpse
death.description: Known for extreme brutality and controversial lyrics.
death.styleNotes: Consistent brutal death metal style throughout their career.

death.name: Morbid Angel
death.description: Pioneering death metal band known for technical complexity and dark themes.
death.styleNotes: Incorporated industrial and electronic elements in later albums.

death.name: Obituary
death.description: Known for their slow, heavy sound and growling vocals.
death.styleNotes: Consistent death/doom style with signature growling vocals.

death.name: Deicide
death.description: Known for satanic themes and aggressive sound.
death.styleNotes: Consistent brutal death metal with anti-religious themes.

death.name: Suffocation
death.description: Pioneers of brutal death metal with slam elements.
death.styleNotes: Created the slam death metal subgenre.

death.name: Nile
death.description: American technical death band known for Egyptian themes.
death.styleNotes: Combines technical death metal with Egyptian mythology.

death.name: Carcass
death.description: British death/grind band known for medical lyrics.
death.styleNotes: Evolved from grindcore to melodic death metal.

death.name: Entombed
death.styleNotes: Created the "Sunlight sound" Swedish death metal production.

black.name: Behemoth
black.styleNotes: Evolved from black metal to death metal with occult themes.

black.name: Mayhem
black.description: One of the most influential black metal bands, known for their controversial history.
black.styleNotes: Evolved from raw black metal to more experimental and avant-garde styles.

black.name: Darkthrone
albums: A Blaze in the Northern Sky
black.description: Pioneering Norwegian black metal band known for raw, lo-fi production.
black.styleNotes: Started as death metal, evolved to raw black metal, later incorporated punk/crust elements.

black.name: Emperor
albums: Anthems to the Welkin at Dusk
black.description: Known for incorporating symphonic elements into black metal.
black.styleNotes: Pioneered symphonic black metal with complex song structures.

black.name: Cradle of Filth
albums: The Principle of Evil Made Flesh
black.description: Known for theatrical style and incorporation of gothic elements.
black.styleNotes: Evolved from raw black metal to more symphonic and gothic styles.

black.name: Dimmu Borgir
black.description: Norwegian black metal band known for symphonic elements and commercial success.
black.styleNotes: Evolved to more polished symphonic black metal with orchestral arrangements.

black.name: Burzum
black.description: One-man black metal project known for atmospheric sound.
black.styleNotes: Evolved from raw black metal to ambient and electronic music.
